result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew G. Binder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew G. Binder

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 2:03 pm case called. Defendant Matthew G. Binder in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement stated on record by ADA Anderson.   Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: No Contest. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court sentences the defendant to: Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA sample to be provided. Appeal Rights Given.

Pre-trial conference at 07-02-2015 10:45 am.
Status conference at 07-20-2015 03:00 pm.
Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.    No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case Called @ 3:10 PM: Defendant Matthew G. Binder in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not wish counsel today and would request a PTC.  Court accepts waiver of counsel.   NGP entered by Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 10:45 am.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

citations.chargeDescr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
